longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid for the period of intended stay. 
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of emergency passports issued to nationals of Guam. 

Visa required, except for A max. stay of 90 days for holders
of a multiple-entry  C  visa issued by a Schengen Member State
 and valid for the period of intended stay. 
Visa required, except for Holders of a valid "D" visa issued
by a Schengen Member State .
Visa required, except for A max. stay of 90 days for nationals
of Guam. 
Minors:
- Unaccompanied minors, who are 17 years of age or younger,
  must hold a letter of consent from the parent/guardian.
- Foreign minors who are 11 years or younger can travel
  without their own visa when . 
Additional Information:
- Extension of stay possible for an additional 60 days with a
  max. stay of 180 days per calendar year for visa exempt
  tourists.
- Extension of stay possible for an additional stay of 150
  days with a max. stay of 180 days per calendar year for
  owners of property in Aruba   
- Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds to
  cover their stay, proof of hotel accommodation and documents
  required for their next destination
Warning:
- Visitors must hold return/onward tickets
